result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lori Ann Deal

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lori Ann Deal in court.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court for Lori Ann Deal.  Attorney Mallory R Davis in court for State of Wisconsin. 
MATTER HEARD OFF THE RECORD. Due to court calendar congestion, case is adjourned for a plea and sentencing in Branch 29.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 15, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Email correspondence with parties. Court is in trial on another matter and unable to hear case. Case re-scheduled for Plea/Sentencing Hearing on 09/29/2022 at 09:30 am, Br 29.
Received and Filed. Plea Questionnaire/ Waiver of rights and Addendum
Received and Filed. Jury Instructions
Received and Filed. Ineligible Voting Notice

Defendant Lori Ann Deal in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Scheduling conference held.  Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast. Defense counsel requests a plea and sentencing hearing.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Lori Ann Deal in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Scheduling conference held.  Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast. Defense counsel needs an offer from the State and requests an additional scheduling conference.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  This hearing will be streamed live via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Lori Ann Deal in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. Defense acknowledges receipt of the Information, waives reading and enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of his client.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  This hearing will be streamed live via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire & Waiver, filed.
signed and filed.

Defendant Lori Ann Deal in court.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a preliminary hearing.  Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast.  Court conducted Indigency Hearing. Court held colloquy with defendant. Court found defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel by court. Defendant requested court appointed counsel and agreed to reimburse Milwaukee County for the expense. The court appointed Atty. Tom Harris, present in court, to represent defendant in this matter at County expense and at the rate of $100.00 per hour. The court ordered the defendant repay the County at a rate of $50.00 per month beginning at the completion of the case, and then the 1st of each month there after. Court advised defendant failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Signed, Distributed & Filed, Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense. Court finds CAUSE to adjourn the preliminary heairng.  Defendant waived time limits for Preliminary Hearing. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  This hearing will be streamed live via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 15, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with ID (DOB 3/13/10); AKD (DOB 3/13/10); VKD (DOB 12/7/12) only supervised contact in accordance with the
nonsecure order in the CHIPS case and supervised by DMCPS or authorized adult.

$750.00 Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.
Remaining cash bail to be returned to the remitter.
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

Defendant Lori Ann Deal in court with attorney Heather L. Johnson.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29. Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 29.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Forwarded for signature.

Actual Date Bond Posted with the Sheriffs Department:
11/25/21.    21RM057083
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Lori Ann Deal not in court.  Jessica Ann Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. Court makes a finding that there is a possible victim identified and stays the forfeiture order with restitution to be determined at close of case.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 1/13/22 @ 1p
